text: The Flying Tortoise
Long ago, the sky people in the clouds planned a great feast.
The Queen of the sky said, "Eveyone who can fly is welcome at the great feast!"
The birds were very excited.
"I can't wait!" said Black Crane.
"It's going to be so good!" said Grey Feather.
"I'm so hungry!" said Yellow Neck and Red Collar.
As they were talking, a sly tortoise was listening.
"Birds, I'm hungry, too.
I go with you?" Tortoise asked.
"Tortoise, you can't flyl" said Black Crane.
"Sure I can," he said.
Then he asked, "May I have a feather, please?"
"Sure," said Black Crane, and handed him a long, black feather.
"Thank you," said Tortoise.
Then Tortoise asked the others, "Would you guys share with me, too?"
"Of course," said Grey Feather, and handed him several feathers.
"Here you go!
Tweet, tweet, tweet!" said Yellow Neck and Red Collar.
The birds were very generous, and they all shared their feathers.
Tortoise took all the feathers and began to build himself wings.
He had a sneaky smile on his face as he worked.
Finally, Tortoise raised his colorful wings and began to fly.
"Look at me!" he shouted.
"I'm flying!"
The birds whistled and said, "Wowl"
"You look like a bird!" said Yellow Neck and Red Collar.
"I should have a bird name, then," said Tortoise.
"What should we call you?" asked Grey Feather.
"Call me 'King of the Birds,'" he said.
"What a funny name for a tortoisel" said Black Crane, laughing.
Tortoise laughed, too, but it was a sneaky laugh.
"Heh, heh, heh."
Then the bird flew to the Great Feast.
"Hello, great Queen of the sky," said Black Crane.
"Welcome!" said the Queen of the sky.
"Who is your leader?"
Tortoise stepped forward.
"I am the King of the Birds."
The Queen thought, "He's so colorful.
He must be their king!"
The birds were very surprised.
Black the Queen said, "Queen, he's not ?"
But the Queen of the sky said, "Shh!"
Grey Feather said, " But the Queen, he's not ?"
"Quiet!" said the Queen.
Yellow Neck and Red Collar said, "No, Queen!  He's not ?"
"SILENCE!" boomed the Queen.
"In my country, the king eats first!"
And so the birds waited while Tortoise went to the great table.
He ate fish cooked with palm-oil.
Chomp, chomp, chomp.
He ate stews and soups.
Slurp, slurp, slurp.
He ate nuts and yams.
Crunch, crunch, crunch.
He ate and he ate, until it was all gone .
The queen said, "What a bad king I He ate ALL the food I"

Then Black Crane yelled, "Tortoise, you are not our kingl" 
and the birds all screeched and screamed.
"Uh, oh," said Tortoise.
"Time to go!"
He tried to fly away, but he had eaten so much that he could not fly very fast.
The birds quickly caught up with him.
"If you won't share with us ... ," said Yellow Neck,
" .. . we won't share with youl" said Red Collar.
They began to take their feathers back.
"Hey! Wait!" cried Tortoise.
"I'm falling!" he cried.
Tortoise flapped and flapped, but he fell like a stone.
CRACK!
He hie the ground and his shell broke into pieces.
"Oh, nol Look at my shell I" he cried.
"You got what you deserved, Tortoise," said Black Crane.
And ever since then, all tortoises have rough shells.
